subject: Re: [junit] How to do parameterized test for many methods in JUnit 4

messageBody:
xlu1983,

If the new method uses the same parameters as the old one, you can
simply add a new metohd to the test class, and re-use the same fields.
If it uses different parameters than the previous method, you will
need to create a different test class. You can group multiple test
classes using the Enclosed runner:

@RunWith(Enclosed.class)
public static void ParseTests {
@RunWith(Parameterized.class)
public static class ParseXmlTests {
...
}

@RunWith(Parameterized.class)
public static class ParseYamlTests {
...
}
}

Good luck,

David Saff
